intro: Cracca glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant has a distinctive fragrance, often described as spicy or aromatic, due to the presence of essential oils in its leaves and stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in temperate regions. Cracca glandulosa is valued both for its ornamental qualities and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
